alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued September 27 at 12:50AM EDT until September 29 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EDT Friday, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to two and a half feet above normal. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 12:09 PM and 12:44 AM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 12:46 AM and 1:15 PM. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 1:22 AM and 1:51 PM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 27/01 AM 3.7 2.1 2.0 1.0 Moderate 27/01 PM 3.6 2.0 2.0 1.0 Moderate 28/01 AM 3.8 2.2 2.1 1.0 Moderate 28/02 PM 3.7 2.1 2.0 1.0 Moderate 29/02 AM 3.6 2.0 1.9 1.0 Moderate 29/02 PM 3.3 1.7 1.6 1.0 Minor &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
